Bridging Technology, Research, and Human Care

Hi, I'm Reza Darooei â€” an FCS Postdoctoral Research Fellow in Software Engineering at the University of Bern, supported by the Swiss Government Excellence Scholarship. I hold a Ph.D. in Biomedical Engineering, specializing in OCT cyst segmentation using deep learning and sparse representation.

My research focuses on developing VR-based blended learning solutions to improve physician-patient communication, especially in managing frightened children during critical care. I believe technology, empathy, and rigorous science together can transform healthcare.

Previously, I worked as a Regulatory Affairs Specialist at Iran FDA, ensuring medical devices and AI systems met stringent safety standards. I am passionate about startups and freelancing, providing early-stage ventures with prototypes, business models, and market research strategies.

My technical expertise spans Python, MATLAB, C++, C#, JavaScript, Unreal Engine, Unity, and game development tools like Daz3D, iClone, and Maya. Whether developing AI models, immersive VR training, or therapeutic games, I strive to create impactful, human-centered solutions.
